010package imagingbook.common.regions;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D.N4;
013
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.Arrays;
016import java.util.List;
017
018import ij.IJ;
019import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
022import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.BinaryRegionSegmentation;
023import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.RegionContourSegmentation;
024import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.SegmentationBackedRegion;
025import imagingbook.common.util.tuples.Tuple2;
026
027/**
028 * Binary region segmenter based on a combined region labeling
029 * and contour tracing algorithm:
030 * F. Chang, C. J. Chen, and C. J. Lu. A linear-time component labeling
031 * algorithm using contour tracing technique. Computer Vision, Graphics,
032 * and Image Processing: Image Understanding 93(2), 206-220 (2004).
033 * Detected regions are 8-connected. 
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2020/04/01
037 * @deprecated Replaced by {@link RegionContourSegmentation}.
038 */
039public class SegmentationRegionContour extends BinaryRegionSegmentation implements ContourTracer { 
040        
041        static private final int VISITED = -1;
042        
043        private List<Contour.Outer> outerContours;
044        private List<Contour.Inner> innerContours;
045        
046        /**
047         * Constructor. Creates a combined region and contour segmenter.
048         * @param ip A binary image with 0 values for background pixels and values &gt; 0
049         * for foreground pixels.
050         */
051        public SegmentationRegionContour(ByteProcessor ip) {
052                this(ip, DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD);
053        }
054        
055        public SegmentationRegionContour(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType2D nh) {
056                super(ip, nh);
057                attachOuterContours();  // attach the outer contour to the corresponding region
058                attachInnerContours();  // attach all inner contours to the corresponding region
059        }
060        
061        // public methods required by interface ContourTracer (others are in inherited from super-class):
062        
063        @Override
064        public List<Contour.Outer> getOuterContours() {
065                return getOuterContours(false);
066        }
067        
068        @Override
069        public List<Contour.Outer> getOuterContours(boolean sort) {
070                Contour.Outer[] oca = outerContours.toArray(new Contour.Outer[0]);
071                if (sort) {
072                        Arrays.sort(oca);
073                }
074                return Arrays.asList(oca);
075        }
076        
077        @Override
078        public List<Contour.Inner> getInnerContours() {
079                return getInnerContours(false);
080        }
081        
082        @Override
083        public List<Contour.Inner> getInnerContours(boolean sort) {
084                Contour.Inner[] ica = innerContours.toArray(new Contour.Inner[0]);
085                if (sort) {
086                        Arrays.sort(ica);
087                }
088                return Arrays.asList(ica);
089        }
090        
091        // non-public methods ------------------------------------------------------------------
092        
093        @Override
094        protected int[][] makeLabelArray() {
095                // Create a label array which is "padded" by 1 pixel, i.e., 
096                // 2 rows and 2 columns larger than the image:
097                int[][] lA = new int[width+2][height+2];        // label array, initialized to zero
098                outerContours = new ArrayList<>();
099                innerContours = new ArrayList<>();
100                return lA;
101        }
102        
103        @Override
104        protected boolean applySegmentation() {
105                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {      // scan top to bottom, left to right
106                        int label = 0;  // reset label, scan through horiz. line:
107                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
108                                if (ip.getPixel(u, v) > 0) {    // hit an unlabeled FOREGROUND pixel
109                                        if (label != 0) { // keep using the same label
110                                                setLabel(u, v, label);
111                                        }
112                                        else {  // label == 0
113                                                label = getLabel(u, v);
114                                                if (label == 0) {       // new (unlabeled) region is hit
115                                                        label = getNextLabel(); // assign a new region label
116                                                        PntInt xs = PntInt.from(u, v);
117                                                        int ds = 0;
118                                                        Contour.Outer c = traceContour(xs, ds, new Contour.Outer(label));
119                                                        outerContours.add(c);
120                                                        setLabel(u, v, label);
121                                                }
122                                        }
123                                } 
124                                else {  // hit a BACKGROUND pixel
125                                        if (label != 0) { // exiting a region
126                                                if (getLabel(u, v) == BACKGROUND) { // unlabeled - new inner contour
127                                                        PntInt xs = PntInt.from(u - 1, v);
128                                                        int ds = (NT == N4) ? 2 : 1;
129                                                        Contour.Inner c = traceContour(xs, ds, new Contour.Inner(label));
130                                                        innerContours.add(c);
131                                                }
132                                                label = 0;
133                                        }
134                                }
135                        }
136                }
137                return true;
138        }
139        
140        // Trace one contour starting at Xs in direction ds     
141        private <T extends Contour> T traceContour(PntInt xs, final int ds, T C) {
142                final int label = C.getLabel(); // C: empty inner or outer contour              
143                
144                Tuple2<PntInt, Integer> next = findNextContourPoint(xs, ds);
145                PntInt x = next.get0();
146                int d = next.get1();    
147                C.addPoint(x);
148                
149                final PntInt xt = x;
150                boolean home = xs.equals(xt);
151                
152                while (!home) {
153                        setLabel(x, label);
154                        PntInt xp = x;
155                        int dn = (d + 6) % 8;
156                        next = findNextContourPoint(x, dn);
157                        x = next.get0();
158                        d = next.get1();
159                        // are we back at the starting position?
160                        home = (xp.equals(xs) && x.equals(xt)); // back at start pos.
161                        if (!home) {
162                                C.addPoint(x);
163                        }
164                }
165                return C;
166        }
167        
168        private static final int[][] delta = {
169                        { 1,0}, { 1, 1}, {0, 1}, {-1, 1}, 
170                        {-1,0}, {-1,-1}, {0,-1}, { 1,-1}};
171
172        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
173        
174        // Starts at point X0 in direction d0, returns a tuple holding
175        // the next point and the direction in which it was found if successful.
176        // Returns null if no successor point is found.
177        private Tuple2<PntInt, Integer> findNextContourPoint(final PntInt x0, final int d0) {
178                final int step = (NT == N4) ? 2 : 1;
179                PntInt x = null;
180                int d = d0;
181                int i = 0;
182                boolean done = false;
183                while (i < 7 && !done) {        // N4: i = 0,2,4,6  N8: i = 0,1,2,3,4,5,6
184                        x = x0.plus(delta[d][0], delta[d][1]);
185                        if (ip.getPixel(x.x, x.y) == BACKGROUND) {
186                                setLabel(x, VISITED);   // mark this background pixel not to be visited again
187                                d = (d + step) % 8;
188                        } 
189                        else {  // found a non-background pixel (next pixel to follow)
190                                done = true;
191                        }
192                        i = i + step;
193                }
194                return (done) ? 
195                                Tuple2.from(x, d) : 
196                                Tuple2.from(x0, d0);    // no successor found
197        }
198        
199        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
200        
201        private void attachOuterContours() {
202                for (Contour.Outer c : outerContours) {
203                        int label = c.getLabel();
204                        BinaryRegion reg = getRegion(label);
205                        if (reg == null) {
206                                IJ.log("Error: Could not associate outer contour with label " + label);
207                        }
208                        else {
209                                reg.setOuterContour(c);
210                        }
211                }
212        }
213        
214        private void attachInnerContours() {
215//              for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
216//                      r.makeInnerContours();  // ensure that every region has a (empty) list of inner contours
217//              }
218                for (Contour.Inner c : innerContours) {
219                        int label = c.getLabel();
220                        SegmentationBackedRegion reg = getRegion(label);
221                        if (reg == null) {
222                                IJ.log("Error: Could not associate inner contour with label " + label);
223                        }
224                        else {
225                                reg.addInnerContour(c);
226                        }
227                }
228        }
229
230        // access methods to the label array (which is padded!)
231        @Override
232        public int getLabel(int u, int v) {     // (u,v) are image coordinates
233                if (u >= -1 && u <= width && v >= -1 && v <= height)
234                        return labelArray[u + 1][v + 1];        // label array is padded (offset = 1)
235                else
236                        return BACKGROUND;
237                //return labelArray[u + 1][v + 1];      // original version
238        }
239        
240        @Override
241        protected void setLabel(int u, int v, int label) { // (u,v) are image coordinates
242                if (u >= -1 && u <= width && v >= -1 && v <= height) {
243                        labelArray[u + 1][v + 1] = label;
244                }
245        }
246        
247        protected void setLabel(PntInt p, int label) { // (u,v) are image coordinates
248                setLabel(p.x, p.y, label);
249        }
250

258//                      }
259//                      return cc;

263}
